summary:
The Security Council:

Reaffirms its previous resolutions on terrorism and Iraq's sovereignty, territorial integrity, and independence.

Recalls the global threat posed by ISIL (Da'esh) through terrorist acts, violent extremism, and gross human rights abuses.

Condemns ISIL's (Da'esh) commission of acts including murder, kidnapping, hostage-taking, and sexual violence.

Recognizes holding ISIL (Da'esh) members accountable for crimes, including war crimes, crimes against humanity, or genocide.

Welcomes Iraq's efforts to defeat ISIL (Da'esh) and recalls its request for international assistance to hold ISIL (Da'esh) members accountable.

Reaffirms resolution 2379 (2017) establishing the Investigative Team.

Takes note of Iraq's request to extend the mandate of the Special Adviser and the Team until 21 September 2020.

Requests the Special Adviser to submit reports to the Council every 180 days.

Decides to remain seized of the matter.
